metadata.Title: CVE-2022-1529 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An attacker could have sent a message to the parent process where the contents were used to double-index into a JavaScript object, leading to prototype pollution and ultimately attacker-controlled JavaScript executing in the privileged parent process. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 91.9.1, Firefox < 100.0.2, Firefox for Android < 100.3.0, and Thunderbird < 91.9.1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1529` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.9.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
